messages.message: Hi team, do we have plans to implement notifications (in app or otherwise) for when a SLA is breached for Human Review?
cc: @jack.robbins not sure if our current notifications initiative covers that

The notifications we’re implementing right now does not cover that. We’d have to think a little more about how this would work, since SLAs apply to individual documents versus the whole run. It would also have to work differently than our current notifications because we have no way of “watching” documents for their SLA expiry right now
Thanks team - if there are any updates on this, do let me know. It would be interesting to understand how this could be implemented with case management too
yep- confirming that this isn't currently in plans for Human Review SLAs. @leila.tan which customer is this from?
If this included notifications (e.g. slack/email) outside of the app, who would receive the notification?
It would be their human review manager and platform owner
Would you imagine there's one HR manager per deployment? Wondering if a system like this could/should be integrated with escalation queues (e.g. if SLA is violated -> auto-escalate)
Based on what they have now, I think it'll be between 1-3 (capacity to manage the HR team)
Let me know if you'd like me to raise a ticket for this request
